poem:
Title: "Ariel, Born of Many Limbs"

In Pembroke's heart, a pup with tales six-fold,
Unwanted yet enduring, brave and bold.
Through verdant vales of charity she roams,
Underneath the undulating Welsh sky's domes.
Surgical steel trims fate's odd design,
Leaves Ariel as canine, less divine.
Yet love's gentle graft is the finest surgeon's art,
To cradle in warmth, a six-legged heart.
